meanings.definition: The act of causing damage to the skin by exposure to wind.
meanings.sent1: After a long day skiing, I developed windburning on my face.
meanings.sent2: The windburning on his cheeks was a painful reminder of the harsh weather.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her windburning made her look like a tomato.
meanings.sent4: The windburning on his hands felt like a fiery touch from nature.
meanings.sent5: The intense windburning left his skin red and raw.

meanings.definition: The result of being affected by windburn.
meanings.sent1: The windburning on her arms was a clear sign of a day spent outdoors.
meanings.sent2: His windburning was evidence of a day spent in the cold, windy weather.
meanings.sent3: The windburning on his face made him resemble a blushing clown.
meanings.sent4: Her windburning was a badge of honor from a day of outdoor adventure.
meanings.sent5: The windburning on his nose was a souvenir from a day of skiing.

meanings.definition: To experience skin irritation due to exposure to wind.
meanings.sent1: I hate when my skin starts windburning after being outside for too long.
meanings.sent2: She always ends up windburning whenever she forgets her scarf.
meanings.sent3: He managed to windburning his face even though he wore sunscreen.
meanings.sent4: The cold wind seemed to actively windburning his cheeks.
meanings.sent5: The windburning sensation made her rush indoors to find relief.
